meanings.definition: The quality or state of being vile.
meanings.sent1: The vileness of his actions shocked everyone.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't stand the vileness of the garbage left on the street.
meanings.sent3: The vileness of the spoiled milk made the whole room smell awful.
meanings.sent4: The vileness of the storm left a path of destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The vileness of the crime scene made it hard to look at.

meanings.definition: The condition of being morally despicable or wicked.
meanings.sent1: The vileness of his lies hurt those around him.
meanings.sent2: The vileness of the betrayal was felt by all.
meanings.sent3: The vileness of the prank was revealed when the truth came out.
meanings.sent4: The vileness of the dictator's actions knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The vileness of the scheme was finally exposed.
